critique: The executive order aims to convey a sense of seriousness and determination in addressing a threat. It highlights the actions of certain members of the Government of Zimbabwe and other persons and declares a national emergency. The order likely intends to instill a sense of concern (fear) about the situation and perhaps some level of disgust towards the actions described. There might also be an element of surprise at the declaration of a national emergency. However, the primary emotions are likely fear and disgust, with a touch of surprise. There is no intention to convey joy or sadness.
